title: First Look: Inside The Design Files Magazine Issue 02!
description: In case you missed it, The Design Files now has a magazine! After launching the debut print edition of our biannual publication last year, we’re now back with Issue 02. And this time, there are even more pages, more home tours, more architectural projects and gardens, plus a whole lot more to explore. See a first look at the magazine below, and pre-order it now to be the first to receive your copy!
author: The Design Files
excerpt: A sneak peek at Issue 02 of The Design Files Magazine! Pre-order your copy now to be the first to get it!
text: For us, a good home should always have some colour. It doesn’t have to be floor to ceiling — it’s about quality over quantity. This is something that unites many of the homes and places we put together for Issue 02 of The Design Files Magazine! Take our cover story, a designer’s 40-square-metre Melbourne apartment that shows how to live large in a small space, with bold accents and a glossy chartreuse front door. We visit plenty of other incredible homes across Australia too, including the idyllic Byron home of graphic designer Holly McCauley and filmmaker Nich Zalmstra; a charming yellow Sydney terrace; and Cungelella artist Glenda McCulloch’s sentimental family home in outback Queensland! Plus, see an elegant Edwardian reimagined by the incredible Flack Studio, and a special feature exploring the fight to save Victoria’s public housing towers. Issue 02 has even more pages than the last (192 to be exact), so there’s plenty more interiors, architecture, gardens, styled shoots, and creatives to read about inside. You can now pre-order the magazine here to get your hands on it before anyone else! Or, Issue 02 will be available in stockists nationwide from April 14. Shop The Design Files Issue 02 online now to receive a pre-order copy from April 7. Already subscribed to our magazine? Thank you for the support! Australian subscribers will receive their copies from April 7. Read the FAQs here.
html:
For us, a good home should always have some colour. It doesn’t have to be floor to ceiling — it’s about quality over quantity.

This is something that unites many of the homes and places we put together for Issue 02 of The Design Files Magazine!

Take our cover story, a designer’s 40-square-metre Melbourne apartment that shows how to live large in a small space, with bold accents and a glossy chartreuse front door.

We visit plenty of other incredible homes across Australia too, including the idyllic Byron home of graphic designer Holly McCauley and filmmaker Nich Zalmstra; a charming yellow Sydney terrace; and Cungelella artist Glenda McCulloch’s sentimental family home in outback Queensland!

Plus, see an elegant Edwardian reimagined by the incredible Flack Studio, and a special feature exploring the fight to save Victoria’s public housing towers.

Issue 02 has even more pages than the last (192 to be exact), so there’s plenty more interiors, architecture, gardens, styled shoots, and creatives to read about inside.

You can now pre-order the magazine here to get your hands on it before anyone else!

Or, Issue 02 will be available in stockists nationwide from April 14.

Shop The Design Files Issue 02 online now to receive a pre-order copy from April 7.

Already subscribed to our magazine? Thank you for the support! Australian subscribers will receive their copies from April 7.

Read the FAQs here.
